review: With a good strong Wi-Fi signal, this thing rocks. My family uses it all the time to stream Netflix. I recently got the T-Mobile Personal CellSpot (a re-branded Asus RT-AC68U Wi-Fi router) and since then the Netflix performance has been excellent. Before that, with a somewhat inferior Wi-Fi router the Chromecast had some trouble maintaining connection.I'd give it five stars if it supported more streaming services. My understanding is that Google is to blame for this by not providing the needed support to 3rd-party developers. In that regard, the Roku boxes far outshine Chromecast. But then again, they typically cost quite a bit more.I've tried casting my Android tablet and phone screen to the Chromecast, and that somewhat works. Usually the result is the movie running in fits and starts, and the phone/tablet dropping connection to the Chromecast after a few minutes. A frustrating way to try to watch a movie, to say the least.If you're content with Netflix and YouTube, this is the device for you.
